message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.CL 

This paper uses network analysis and data science to study the Twitter conversation following the Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, which falls under the category of social media analysis. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses principal component analysis (PCA) and community detection, which are techniques commonly used in data science and machine learning, suggesting cs.SD (Software Engineering) as another possible sub-category. The paper also examines the structure of a retweet network, which falls under the category of network science, suggesting cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks) as a possible sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of hate symbols and language, which relates to cybersecurity and online safety, suggesting cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity and Privacy) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper analyzes tweet content and language, which falls under the category of natural language processing, suggesting cs.CL (Computation and Language) as a possible sub-category.
